ai-an1:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an1:1.2.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a man’s mind like the sight of a woman.
ai-an1:1.2.2_0: The sight of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
ai-an1:2.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a man’s mind like the sound of a woman.
ai-an1:2.1.2_0: The sound of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
ai-an1:3.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a man’s mind like the smell of a woman.
ai-an1:3.1.2_0: The smell of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
ai-an1:4.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a man’s mind like the taste of a woman.
ai-an1:4.1.2_0: The taste of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
ai-an1:5.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a man’s mind like the touch of a woman.
ai-an1:5.1.2_0: The touch of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
ai-an1:6.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a woman’s mind like the sight of a man.
ai-an1:6.1.2_0: The sight of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
ai-an1:6.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:7.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a woman’s mind like the sound of a man.
ai-an1:7.1.2_0: The sound of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
ai-an1:8.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a woman’s mind like the smell of a man.
ai-an1:8.1.2_0: The smell of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
ai-an1:9.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a woman’s mind like the taste of a man.
ai-an1:9.1.2_0: The taste of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
ai-an1:10.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a woman’s mind like the touch of a man.
ai-an1:10.1.2_0: The touch of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
ai-an1:10.1.4_0: The first sub-chapter on sights is finished.
ai-an1:11.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to sensual desire, or, when it has arisen, makes it increase and grow like the feature of beauty.
ai-an1:11.1.2_0: When you attend improperly to the feature of things, sensual desire arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.”
ai-an1:12.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to ill will, or, when it has arisen, makes it increase and grow like the feature of harshness.
ai-an1:12.1.2_0: When you attend improperly to the feature of harshness, ill will arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.”
ai-an1:13.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to dullness and drowsiness, or, when they have arisen, makes them increase and grow like discontent, sloth, yawning, sleepiness after eating, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an1:13.1.2_0: When you have a sluggish mind, dullness and drowsiness arise, and once arisen they increase and grow.”
ai-an1:14.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to restlessness and remorse, or, when they have arisen, makes them increase and grow like an unsettled mind.
ai-an1:14.1.2_0: When you have no peace of mind, restlessness and remorse arise, and once arisen they increase and grow.”
ai-an1:15.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to doubt, or, when it has arisen, makes it increase and grow like improper attention.
ai-an1:15.1.2_0: When you attend improperly, doubt arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.”
ai-an1:16.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents sensual desire from arising, or, when it has arisen, abandons it like the feature of ugliness.
ai-an1:16.1.2_0: When you attend properly to the feature of ugliness, sensual desire does not arise, or, if it has already arisen, it’s given up.”
ai-an1:16.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:17.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents ill will from arising, or, when it has arisen, abandons it like the heart’s release by love.
ai-an1:17.1.2_0: When you attend properly on the heart’s release by love, ill will does not arise, or, if it has already arisen, it’s given up.”
ai-an1:18.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents dullness and drowsiness from arising, or, when they have arisen, gives them up like the elements of initiative, persistence, and vigor.
ai-an1:18.1.2_0: When you’re energetic, dullness and drowsiness do not arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re given up.”
ai-an1:19.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents restlessness and remorse from arising, or, when they have arisen, gives them up like peace of mind.
ai-an1:19.1.2_0: When your mind is peaceful, restlessness and remorse do not arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re given up.”
ai-an1:20.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents doubt from arising, or, when it has arisen, gives it up like proper attention.
ai-an1:20.1.2_0: When you attend properly, doubt does not arise, or, if it’s already arisen, it’s given up.”
ai-an1:21.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed like this, is as useless as the mind.
ai-an1:22.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed like this, is as workable as the mind.
ai-an1:23.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed like this, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:23.1.2_0: An undeveloped mind is very harmful.”
ai-an1:24.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed like this, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:24.1.2_0: A developed mind is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:25.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed, with such untapped potential, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:25.1.2_0: An undeveloped mind, with untapped potential, is very harmful.”
ai-an1:26.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed like this, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:26.1.2_0: A developed mind, with its potential realized, is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:26.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:27.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed and cultivated, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:27.1.2_0: An undeveloped and uncultivated mind is very harmful.”
ai-an1:28.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed and cultivated, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:28.1.2_0: A developed and cultivated mind is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:29.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed and cultivated, brings such suffering as the mind.
ai-an1:29.1.2_0: An undeveloped and uncultivated mind brings suffering.”
ai-an1:30.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed and cultivated, brings such happiness as the mind.
ai-an1:30.1.2_0: A developed and cultivated mind brings happiness.”
ai-an1:30.1.4_0: The third sub-chapter on work is finished.
ai-an1:31.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not tamed, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:31.1.2_0: A wild mind is very harmful.”
ai-an1:32.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is tamed, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:32.1.2_0: A tamed mind is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:33.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not guarded, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:33.1.2_0: An unguarded mind is very harmful.”
ai-an1:34.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is guarded, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:34.1.2_0: A guarded mind is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:35.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not protected, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:35.1.2_0: An unprotected mind is very harmful.”
ai-an1:36.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is protected, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:36.1.2_0: A protected mind is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:36.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:37.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not restrained, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:37.1.2_0: An unrestrained mind is very harmful.”
ai-an1:38.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is restrained, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:38.1.2_0: A restrained mind is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:39.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is not tamed, guarded, protected, and restrained, is so very harmful as the mind.
ai-an1:39.1.2_0: An untamed, unguarded, unprotected, and unrestrained mind is very harmful.”
ai-an1:40.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is tamed, guarded, protected, and restrained, is so very beneficial as the mind.
ai-an1:40.1.2_0: A tamed, guarded, protected, and restrained mind is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:40.1.4_0: The fourth sub-chapter on unbounds is finished.
ai-an1:41.1.1_0: “Mendicants, suppose a spike of rice or barley was pointing the wrong way. If you trod on it with hand or foot, there’s no way it could break the skin and produce blood.
ai-an1:41.1.3_0: Because the spike is pointing the wrong way.
ai-an1:41.1.4_0: In the same way, a mendicant whose mind is pointing the wrong way cannot break ignorance, produce knowledge, and realize extinguishment.
ai-an1:41.1.6_0: Because their mind is pointing the wrong way.”
ai-an1:42.1.1_0: “Mendicants, suppose a spike of rice or barley was pointing the right way. If you trod on it with hand or foot, it may well break the skin and produce blood.
ai-an1:42.1.3_0: Because the spike is pointing the right way.
ai-an1:42.1.4_0: In the same way, a mendicant whose mind is pointing the right way may well break ignorance, produce knowledge, and realize extinguishment.
ai-an1:42.1.6_0: Because the mind is pointing the right way.”
ai-an1:43.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when I’ve comprehended the mind of a person whose mind is corrupted, I understand:
ai-an1:43.1.2_0: ‘If this person were to die right now, they would be cast down to hell.’
ai-an1:43.1.5_0: Corruption of mind is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
ai-an1:44.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when I’ve comprehended the mind of a person whose mind is pure, I understand:
ai-an1:44.1.2_0: ‘If this person were to die right now, they would be raised up to heaven.’
ai-an1:44.1.5_0: Purity of mind is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-an1:45.1.1_0: “Suppose, mendicants, there was a lake that was transparent, clear, and unclouded. A person with good eyesight standing on the bank would see the mussel shells, gravel and pebbles, and schools of fish swimming about or staying still.
ai-an1:45.1.4_0: In the same way, that a mendicant whose mind is clouded would know what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both; or that they would realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones: this is not possible.
ai-an1:46.1.1_0: “Suppose, mendicants, there was a lake that was transparent, clear, and unclouded. A person with good eyesight standing on the bank would see the mussel shells, gravel and pebbles, and schools of fish swimming about or staying still.
ai-an1:46.1.4_0: In the same way, that a mendicant whose mind is not clouded would know what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both; or that they would realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones: this is possible.
ai-an1:46.1.7_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:47.1.1_0: “Just as, mendicants, the boxwood is said to be the best kind of tree in terms of its pliability and workability,
ai-an1:47.1.2_0: so too, I do not see a single thing that’s as pliable and workable as the mind, when it is developed and cultivated.
ai-an1:47.1.3_0: A mind that is developed and cultivated is pliable and workable.”
ai-an1:48.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that’s as quick to change as the mind.
ai-an1:48.1.2_0: So much so that it’s not easy to give a simile for how quickly the mind changes.”
ai-an1:49.1.2_0: But it is corrupted by passing corruptions.”
ai-an1:50.1.2_0: And it is freed from passing corruptions.”
ai-an1:50.1.4_0: The fifth sub-chapter on molasses is finished.
ai-an1:51.1.2_0: But it is corrupted by passing corruptions.
ai-an1:51.1.3_0: An uneducated ordinary person does not truly understand this.
ai-an1:51.1.4_0: So I say that the uneducated ordinary person has no development of the mind.”
ai-an1:52.1.2_0: But it is freed from corruptions.
ai-an1:52.1.3_0: An educated noble disciple truly understands this.
ai-an1:52.1.4_0: So I say that the educated noble disciple has development of the mind.”
ai-an1:53.1.1_0: “If, mendicants, a mendicant cultivates a mind of love even as long as a finger-snap,
ai-an1:53.1.3_0: ‘A mendicant who lives in the Teacher’s instructions and takes advice to eat the instructions,’
ai-an1:53.1.4_0: How much more so those who make much of it!”
ai-an1:54.1.1_0: “If, mendicants, a mendicant develops a mind of love even as long as a finger-snap,
ai-an1:54.1.3_0: ‘A mendicant who lives in the Teacher’s instructions and takes advice to eat the instructions,’
ai-an1:54.1.4_0: How much more so those who make much of it!”
ai-an1:55.1.1_0: “If, mendicants, a mendicant focuses on love even as long as a finger-snap,
ai-an1:55.1.3_0: ‘A mendicant who lives in the Teacher’s instructions and takes advice to eat the instructions,’
ai-an1:55.1.4_0: How much more so those who make much of it!”
ai-an1:56.1.1_0: “Mendicants, intention shapes all phenomena whatsoever that are unskillful, part of the unskillful, on the side of the unskillful.
ai-an1:56.1.2_0: mind arises first and thoughts connected with the mind.”
ai-an1:56.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:57.1.1_0: “Mendicants, intention shapes all phenomena whatsoever that are skillful, part of the skillful, on the side of the skillful.
ai-an1:57.1.2_0: mind arises first thoughts, and thoughts are skillful.”
ai-an1:58.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like negligence.
ai-an1:58.1.2_0: When you’re negligent, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:59.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like diligence.
ai-an1:59.1.2_0: When you’re diligent, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:60.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like laziness.
ai-an1:60.1.2_0: When you’re lazy, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:60.1.4_0: The sixth sub-chapter on skins is finished.
ai-an1:61.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like arousing energy.
ai-an1:61.1.2_0: When you’re energetic, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:62.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like having many wishes.
ai-an1:62.1.2_0: When you have many wishes, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:63.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like having few wishes.
ai-an1:63.1.2_0: When you have few wishes, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:64.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like lack of contentment.
ai-an1:64.1.2_0: When you lack contentment, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:65.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like contentment.
ai-an1:65.1.2_0: When you’re contented, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:66.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like improper attention.
ai-an1:66.1.2_0: When you attend improperly, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:66.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:67.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like proper attention.
ai-an1:67.1.2_0: When you attend properly, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:68.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like lack of situational awareness.
ai-an1:68.1.2_0: When you lack situational awareness, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:69.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like situational awareness.
ai-an1:69.1.2_0: When you’re full of situational awareness, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:70.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like bad friends.
ai-an1:70.1.2_0: When you have bad friends, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:70.1.4_0: The seventh substance, energy, and so on.
ai-an1:71.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like good friends.
ai-an1:71.1.2_0: When you have good friends, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:72.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like pursuing bad habits and not good habits.
ai-an1:72.1.2_0: When you pursue bad habits and not good habits, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:73.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like pursuing bad habits and not good habits.
ai-an1:73.1.2_0: When you pursue good habits and not bad habits, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:74.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents the awakening factors from arising, or, if they’ve already arisen, prevents them from being fully developed like improper attention.
ai-an1:74.1.2_0: When you attend improperly, the awakening factors don’t arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re not fully developed.”
ai-an1:75.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to the awakening factors like proper attention.
ai-an1:75.1.2_0: When you attend properly, the awakening factors arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re fully developed.”
ai-an1:76.1.1_0: “Loss of relatives, mendicants, is a small thing.
ai-an1:76.1.2_0: This includes the decline of wisdom is the growth of wisdom.”
ai-an1:76.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an1:77.1.1_0: “Growth of relatives, mendicants, is a small thing.
ai-an1:77.1.2_0: Wisdom is the best thing to grow.
ai-an1:77.1.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an1:78.1.1_0: “Loss of wealth, mendicants, is a small thing.
ai-an1:78.1.2_0: This includes the decline of wisdom is the growth of wisdom.”
ai-an1:79.1.1_0: “Growth of wealth, mendicants, is a small thing.
ai-an1:79.1.2_0: Wisdom is the best thing to grow.
ai-an1:79.1.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an1:80.1.1_0: “Loss of fame, mendicants, is a small thing.
ai-an1:80.1.2_0: This includes the decline of wisdom is the growth of wisdom.”
ai-an1:81.1.1_0: “Growth of fame, mendicants, is a small thing.
ai-an1:81.1.2_0: Wisdom is the best thing to grow.
ai-an1:81.1.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an1:81.1.7_0: The eighth sub-chapter on good friends is finished.

ai-an1:86.1.2_0: Having many wishes is very harmful.”
ai-an1:87.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that is so very beneficial as having few wishes.
ai-an1:87.1.2_0: Having few wishes is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:87.1.3_0: The sixth offering to an individual.

ai-an1:88.1.2_0: Lack of contentment is very harmful.”
ai-an1:89.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that is so very beneficial as contentment.

ai-an1:96.1.2_0: Pursuing bad habits and not good habits is very harmful.”
ai-an1:97.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that is so very beneficial as pursuing good habits and not bad habits.
ai-an1:97.1.2_0: Pursuing good habits and not bad habits is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:97.1.4_0: The ninth sub-chapter on negligence is finished.
ai-an1:98.1.1_0: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very harmful as negligence.
ai-an1:99.1.1_0: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very beneficial as diligence.
ai-an1:100.1.1_0: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very harmful as laziness.
ai-an1:101.1.1_0: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very beneficial as arousing energy.
ai-an1:102-109.1.1_0: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very harmful as having many wishes. ...”
ai-an1:110.1.1_0: “Taking into account exterior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very harmful as bad friends.
ai-an1:111.1.1_0: “Taking into account exterior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very beneficial as good friends.
ai-an1:112.1.1_0: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very harmful as pursuing bad habits and not good habits.
ai-an1:112.1.2_0: Pursuing bad habits and not good habits is very harmful.”
ai-an1:113.1.1_0: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very harmful as pursuing bad habits and not good habits.
ai-an1:113.1.2_0: Pursuing good habits and not bad habits is very beneficial.”
ai-an1:114.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching like negligence.
ai-an1:114.1.2_0: Negligence leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.”
ai-an1:115.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching like diligence.
ai-an1:115.1.2_0: Diligence leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
ai-an1:116.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching like laziness.
ai-an1:116.1.2_0: Laziness leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.”
ai-an1:117.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching like arousing energy.
ai-an1:117.1.2_0: Arousing energy leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
ai-an1:118-128.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching like having many wishes.
ai-an1:118-128.1.1_10: for bad habits and not good habits.
ai-an1:118-128.1.2_0: Pursuing bad habits and not good habits leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.”
ai-an1:129.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching like pursuing good habits and not bad habits.
ai-an1:129.1.2_0: Pursuing good habits and not bad habits leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching”
ai-an1:129.1.4_0: The group of four is finished.
ai-an1:130.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain what is not the teaching as the teaching are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an1:130.1.2_0: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
ai-an1:131.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain what is the teaching as not the teaching are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an1:131.1.2_0: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain what is contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law. ...
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_1: They proclaim what is the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law.
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_2: They proclaim what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by the Buddha. They explain what was spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha.
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_3: They proclaim what has been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha.
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_4: They proclaim what was not practiced by the Buddha as practiced by the Buddha.
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_5: They proclaim what was practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by the Buddha.
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_6: They proclaim what was not laid down by the Buddha as laid down by the Buddha.
ai-an1:132-139.1.1_7: and what was prescribed by the Realized One as not prescribed by the Realized One.
ai-an1:132-139.1.2_0: are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of many people, of gods and humans.
ai-an1:132-139.1.3_0: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
ai-an1:132-139.1.4_0: if he touches the right speech;
ai-an1:132-139.1.5_0: The tenth sub-chapter on negligence is finished.
ai-an1:140.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain what is not the teaching as not the teaching are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an1:140.1.2_0: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
ai-an1:141.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain what is the teaching as the teaching are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an1:141.1.2_0: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Teaching ...
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_1: They proclaim what is the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_2: They proclaim what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha. They explain what was not spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha. ...
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_3: They proclaim what has been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by the Buddha.
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_4: They proclaim what was not practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by the Buddha.
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_5: They proclaim what was practiced by the Buddha as practiced by the Buddha.
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_6: They proclaim what was not laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by the Buddha.
ai-an1:142-149.1.1_7: and what was laid down by the Buddha as laid down by the Buddha.
ai-an1:142-149.1.2_0: are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of the people, of gods and humans.
ai-an1:142-149.1.3_0: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
ai-an1:150.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain non-offense as an offense are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an1:150.1.2_0: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
ai-an1:151.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain an offense as non-offense are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an1:151.1.2_0: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_0: “Those mendicants who explain a light offense as a light offense ...
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_1: They proclaim a heavy offense as light.
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_2: They proclaim a grave offense as minor.
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_3: They proclaim a minor offense as grave.
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_4: They proclaim a curable offense as incurable.
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_5: They proclaim an incurable offense as curable.
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_6: They proclaim a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense as an offense. ...
ai-an1:152-159.1.1_7: They explain an offense as an offense, and acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an1:152-159.1.2_0: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”
ai-an1:160.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain non-offense as non-offense are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an1:160.1.2_0: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
ai-an1:161.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain an offense as an offense are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an1:161.1.2_0: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_0: “Those mendicants who explain a light offense as light,
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_1: They proclaim a heavy offense as heavy.
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_2: They proclaim a grave offense as grave.
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_3: They proclaim a minor offense as minor.
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_4: They proclaim a curable offense as curable.
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_5: They proclaim an incurable offense as incurable.
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_6: They proclaim a legal procedure with an offense as an offense,
ai-an1:162-169.1.1_7: They proclaim a legal procedure against one who hasn’t committed an offense.
ai-an1:162-169.1.2_0: are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of the people, of gods and humans.
ai-an1:162-169.1.3_0: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”
ai-an1:162-169.1.5_0: There is no offense for twelve (years),
ai-an1:170.1.1_0: “One person, mendicants, arises in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an1:170.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an1:170.1.4_0: This is one person who arises in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”
ai-an1:171.1.1_0: “The appearance of one person, mendicants, is rare in the world.
ai-an1:171.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an1:171.1.4_0: This is the one person, mendicants, whose appearance is rare in the world.”
ai-an1:172.1.1_0: “One person, mendicants, arises in the world who is an incredible human being.
ai-an1:172.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an1:172.1.4_0: This is the one person, mendicants, who arises in the world an incredible human being.”
ai-an1:173.1.1_0: “The death of one person, mendicants, is regretted by many people.
ai-an1:173.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an1:173.1.4_0: This is the one person, mendicants, whose death is regretted by many people.”
ai-an1:174.1.1_0: “One person, mendicants, arises in the world who is unique, without peer or counterpart, incomparable, matchless, unrivaled, unequaled, without equal, the best of bipeds.
ai-an1:174.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an1:174.1.4_0: This is the one person, mendicants, who arises in the world unique, without peer or counterpart, incomparable, matchless, unrivaled, unequaled, without equal, the best of bipeds.”
ai-an1:175-186.1.1_0: “With the appearance of one person, mendicants, there is the appearance of a great eye, a great light, a great radiance, and the six unsurpassable things; the realization of the four kinds of textual analysis; the penetration of many and diverse elements; the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom; the realization of the fruits of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, and perfection.
ai-an1:175-186.1.3_0: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an1:175-186.1.4_0: This is the one person, when the eye, is appears, a great light, a great radiance, and the six unsurpassable things; the realization of the four kinds of textual analysis; the penetration of many and diverse elements; the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom; the realization of the fruits of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, and perfection.”
ai-an1:187.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single other person who rightly keeps rolling the supreme Wheel of Dhamma that was rolled forth by the Realized One like Sāriputta.
ai-an1:187.1.2_0: Sāriputta rightly keeps rolling the supreme Wheel of Dhamma that was rolled forth by the Realized One.”
ai-an1:187.1.3_0: The taste of an excellent person,
ai-an1:188.1.1_0: “The foremost of my monk disciples in seniority is Aññākoṇḍañña.
ai-an1:193.1.1_0: ... from eminent families is Bhaddiya Kāḷigodhāyaputta.
ai-an1:194.1.1_0: ... with a charming voice is Lakuṇṭaka Bhaddiya.
ai-an1:195.1.1_0: ... who are hunters is Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja.
ai-an1:196.1.1_0: ... who speak on the teaching is Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta.
ai-an1:197.1.1_0: ... who explain in detail the meaning of a brief statement is Mahākaccāna.”
ai-an1:198.1.1_0: “The foremost of my monk disciples in creating a mind-made body is Cūḷapanthaka.
ai-an1:199.1.1_0: ... who are skilled in the evolution of consciousness is Cūḷapanthaka.
ai-an1:200.1.1_0: ... who are skilled in the evolution of perception is Mahāpanthaka.
ai-an1:201.1.1_0: ... who dwell in abstaining is Subhūti.
ai-an1:202.1.1_0: ... who are worthy of a religious donation is Subhūti.
ai-an1:203.1.1_0: ... who dwell in the wilderness is Revata country.
ai-an1:205.1.1_0: ... who are energetic is Soṇa Koḷivisa.
ai-an1:206.1.1_0: ... who are good speakers is Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa.
ai-an1:207.1.1_0: ... who receive many possessions is Sīvali.
ai-an1:208.1.1_0: ... who are strong in faith is Vappa.”
ai-an1:208.1.2_0: The second sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:209.1.1_0: “The foremost of my monk disciples who want to train is Rāhula.
ai-an1:210.1.1_0: ... who went forth out of faith is Raṭṭhapāla.
ai-an1:211.1.1_0: ... who are the first to pick up a ballot slip is Kuṇḍadhāna.
ai-an1:212.1.1_0: ... who are eloquent poets is Vaṅgīsa.
ai-an1:213.1.1_0: ... who are impressive all around is Upasena Vaṅgantaputta.
ai-an1:214.1.1_0: ... who assign lodgings is Dabba Mallaputta.
ai-an1:216.1.1_0: ... with swift insight is Bāhiya of the Bark Cloth.
ai-an1:217.1.1_0: ... with brilliant speech is Kassapa the Prince.
ai-an1:218.1.1_0: ... who have attained the methods of textual analysis is Mahākoṭṭhita.”
ai-an1:218.1.2_0: The third sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:219.1.1_0: “The foremost of my monk disciples in seniority is Ānanda.
ai-an1:220.1.1_0: ... with a good memory is Ānanda.
ai-an1:221.1.1_0: ... with an extensive range is Ānanda.
ai-an1:223.1.1_0: ... as a personal attendant is Ānanda.
ai-an1:224.1.1_0: ... with a large congregation is Uruvelakassapa.
ai-an1:225.1.1_0: ... who inspire lay families is Kāḷudāyī.
ai-an1:227.1.1_0: ... who recollect past lives is Sobhita.
ai-an1:228.1.1_0: ... who have memorized the texts on monastic training is Upāli.
ai-an1:229.1.1_0: ... who advise the nuns is Nandaka.
ai-an1:230.1.1_0: ... who guard the sense doors is Nanda.
ai-an1:231.1.1_0: ... who advise the nuns is Mahākappina.
ai-an1:232.1.1_0: ... who are skilled in the fire element is Sāgata.
ai-an1:233.1.1_0: ... who inspire eloquent teachings is Rādha.
ai-an1:234.1.1_0: ... who wear coarse robes is Mogharāja.”
ai-an1:234.1.2_0: The fourth sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:235.1.1_0: “The foremost of my nun disciples in seniority is Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī.
ai-an1:238.1.1_0: ... who have memorized the texts on monastic training is Paṭācārā.
ai-an1:239.1.1_0: ... who speak on the teaching is Dhammadinnā.
ai-an1:243.1.1_0: ... with swift insight is Bhaddā Kuṇḍalakesā.
ai-an1:244.1.1_0: ... who recollect past lives is Bhaddā Kāpilānī.
ai-an1:245.1.1_0: ... who have attained great insight is Bhaddakaccānā.
ai-an1:246.1.1_0: ... who wear coarse robes is Kisāgotamī.
ai-an1:247.1.1_0: ... who are strong in faith is Siṅgālakamātā.”
ai-an1:247.1.2_0: The fifth sub-chapter on making amends.
ai-an1:248.1.1_0: “The foremost of my laymen in first going for refuge are the merchants Tapussa and Bhallika.
ai-an1:249.1.1_0: ... who give gifts is Sudatta Anāthapiṇḍika.
ai-an1:250.1.1_0: ... who speak on the teaching is Macchikāsaṇḍa.
ai-an1:251.1.1_0: ... who attract a congregation by the four ways of being inclusive is Hatthaka Āḷavaka.
ai-an1:252.1.1_0: ... who donate fine things is Mahānāma Sakka.
ai-an1:253.1.1_0: ... who donate nice things is the householder Ugga of Vesālī.
ai-an1:254.1.1_0: ... who attend on the Saṅgha is the householder Uggata of Hatthi Village.
ai-an1:255.1.1_0: ... who have experiential confidence is Ambaṭṭha.
ai-an1:256.1.1_0: ... who have confidence in a person is Jīvaka Komārabhacca.
ai-an1:257.1.1_0: ... who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s father.”
ai-an1:257.1.2_0: The sixth sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:258.1.1_0: “The foremost of my laywomen in first going for refuge is Sujātā Seniyadhītā.
ai-an1:259.1.1_0: ... as a donor is Visākhā, Migāra’s mother.
ai-an1:260.1.1_0: ... who are very learned is Khujjuttarā.
ai-an1:261.1.1_0: ... who dwell in love is Sāmāvatī.
ai-an1:263.1.1_0: ... who give fine things is Suppavāsā Koliyadhītā.
ai-an1:265.1.1_0: ... who have experiential confidence is Kātiyānī.
ai-an1:266.1.1_0: ... who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s mother.
ai-an1:267.1.1_0: ... whose confidence is based on oral transmission is the laywoman Kuraraghara.”
ai-an1:267.1.2_0: The seventh sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:267.1.3_0: The sub-chapter on fire is finished.
ai-an1:268.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to take any condition as permanent.
ai-an1:268.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to take some condition as permanent.
ai-an1:269.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to take any condition as pleasant.
ai-an1:269.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to take some condition as pleasant.
ai-an1:270.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to take anything as self.
ai-an1:270.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to take something as self.
ai-an1:271.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to murder their mother.
ai-an1:271.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to murder their mother.”
ai-an1:272.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to murder their father.
ai-an1:272.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to murder their father.
ai-an1:273.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to murder a perfected one.
ai-an1:273.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to murder a perfected one.
ai-an1:274.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to injure a Realized One with malicious intent.
ai-an1:274.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to injure a Realized One with malicious intent.
ai-an1:275.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to cause a schism in the Saṅgha.
ai-an1:275.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to cause a schism in the Saṅgha.”
ai-an1:276.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a person accomplished in view to acknowledge another teacher.
ai-an1:276.1.2_0: But it is possible for an ordinary person to acknowledge another teacher.
ai-an1:277.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that two perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas to arise in the same solar system at the same time.
ai-an1:277.1.2_0: But it is possible for just one perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, to arise in one solar system.
ai-an1:278.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for two wheel-turning monarchs to arise in the same solar system at the same time.
ai-an1:278.1.2_0: But it is possible for just one wheel-turning monarch to arise in one solar system.
ai-an1:279.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a woman to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an1:279.1.2_0: But it is possible for a man to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.”
ai-an1:280.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a woman to be a wheel-turning monarch.
ai-an1:280.1.2_0: But it is possible for a man to be a wheel-turning monarch.”
ai-an1:281-283.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a woman to perform the role of identity.
ai-an1:281-283.1.2_0: But it is possible that a man might build up their own essence. ...
ai-an1:284.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from bad bodily conduct.
ai-an1:284.1.2_0: But it is possible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from bad bodily conduct.
ai-an1:285-286.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for someone who has bad verbal conduct ...
ai-an1:285-286.1.2_0: But it is possible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from bad verbal ...
ai-an1:285-286.1.3_0: The second sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:287.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from good bodily conduct.
ai-an1:287.1.2_0: But it is possible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from good bodily conduct.
ai-an1:288-289.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone accomplished in good verbal conduct ...
ai-an1:288-289.1.1_1: For one of good verbal, unlikable, undesirable, and disagreeable results.
ai-an1:288-289.1.2_0: But it is possible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from good verbal ... good mental conduct.
ai-an1:290.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct, could for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an1:290.1.2_0: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an1:291-292.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone with bad verbal conduct could do bad things by way of speech.
ai-an1:291-292.1.1_1: When their body breaks up, after death, you’d be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an1:291-292.1.2_0: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in bad verbal ... bad mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an1:293.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone who has engaged in good bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an1:293.1.2_0: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in good bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an1:294-295.1.1_0: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone accomplished in good verbal conduct ...
ai-an1:294-295.1.1_1: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an1:294-295.1.2_0: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in good verbal ... good mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, heavenly realm.
ai-an1:294-295.1.3_0: The third sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:294-295.1.4_0: The canonical text on the ground is finished.
ai-an1:296.1.1_0: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-an1:296.1.4_0: This is the one thing that, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
ai-an1:297-305.1.1_0: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-an1:297-305.1.4_0: This is the one thing that, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
ai-an1:306.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or, when they have arisen, makes them increase and grow like wrong view.
ai-an1:306.1.2_0: When you have wrong view, unskillful qualities arise or, when they have arisen, they increase and grow.”
ai-an1:307.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or, when they have arisen, makes them increase and grow like right view.
ai-an1:307.1.2_0: When you have right view, unarisen skillful qualities arise or, when they have arisen, they increase and grow.”
ai-an1:308.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like wrong view.
ai-an1:308.1.2_0: When you have wrong view, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:309.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like right view.
ai-an1:309.1.2_0: When you have right view, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”
ai-an1:310.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to wrong view, and once arisen, makes it grow like improper attention.
ai-an1:310.1.2_0: When you attend improperly, wrong view arises, and once arisen it grows.”
ai-an1:311.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to right view, or, once it has already arisen, makes it grow like proper attention.
ai-an1:311.1.2_0: When you attend properly, right view arises, and once arisen it grows.”
ai-an1:312.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that causes sentient beings to be reborn, when their body breaks up, after death, in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell like wrong view.
ai-an1:312.1.2_0: It is because they have wrong view that sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
ai-an1:313.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that causes sentient beings to be reborn, when their body breaks up, after death, in a good place, a heavenly realm like right view.
ai-an1:313.1.2_0: It is because they have right view that sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-an1:314.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when an individual has wrong view, whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view. ...
ai-an1:314.1.1_1: Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable, harmful, and suffering.
ai-an1:314.1.4_0: Suppose a seed of neem, angled gourd, or bitter gourd was planted in moist earth. Whatever nutrients it takes up from the earth and water would lead to its bitter, acerbic, and unpleasant taste.
ai-an1:314.1.7_0: In the same way, when an individual has wrong view, whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view. ...
ai-an1:314.1.7_1: Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable, harmful, and suffering.
ai-an1:315.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when an individual has right view, whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view. ...
ai-an1:315.1.1_1: Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, beneficial, and pleasant.
ai-an1:315.1.4_0: Suppose a seed of sugar cane, fine rice, or grape was planted in moist earth. Whatever nutrients it takes up from the earth and water would lead to its sweet, pleasant, and delicious taste.
ai-an1:315.1.7_0: In the same way, when an individual has right view, whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view. ...
ai-an1:315.1.7_1: Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, beneficial, and pleasant.
ai-an1:315.1.10_0: The second sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:316.1.1_0: “One person, mendicants, arises in the world for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-an1:316.1.3_0: They have wrong view. Their perspective is distorted:
ai-an1:316.1.4_0: They draw many people away from the true teaching and establish them in false teachings.
ai-an1:316.1.5_0: This is one person who arises in the world for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.”
ai-an1:317.1.1_0: “One person, mendicants, arises in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
ai-an1:317.1.4_0: They draw many people away from false teachings and establish them in the true teaching.
ai-an1:317.1.5_0: This is one person who arises in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”
ai-an1:318.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that’s as wrong view.
ai-an1:318.1.2_0: Wrong view is the most blameworthy thing of all.”
ai-an1:319.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I do not see a single other person who acts for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of many people, of gods and humans like that silly man, Makkhali.
ai-an1:319.1.2_0: Just as a trap set at the mouth of a river would bring harm, suffering, calamity, and disaster for many fish.
ai-an1:319.1.3_0: so too that silly man, Makkhali, is a trap for humans, it seems to me. He has arisen in the world for the harm, suffering, calamity, and disaster of many beings.”
ai-an1:320.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the one who encourages someone in a poorly explained teaching and training, the one who they encourage, and the one who practices accordingly all make much bad karma.
ai-an1:320.1.3_0: Because the teaching is poorly explained.”
ai-an1:321.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the one who encourages someone in a well explained teaching and training, the one who they encourage, and the one who practices accordingly all make much merit.
ai-an1:321.1.3_0: Because the teaching is well explained.”
ai-an1:322.1.1_0: “Mendicants, in a poor teaching and training, the recipient should know moderation, not the recipient.
ai-an1:322.1.3_0: Because the teaching is poorly explained.”
ai-an1:323.1.1_0: “Mendicants, in a well explained teaching and training, the recipient should know moderation, not the donor.
ai-an1:323.1.3_0: Because the teaching is well explained.”
ai-an1:324.1.1_0: “Mendicants, in a poor teaching and training an energetic person lives in suffering.
ai-an1:324.1.3_0: Because the teaching is poorly explained.”
ai-an1:325.1.1_0: “Mendicants, in a well explained teaching and training a lazy person lives in suffering.
ai-an1:325.1.3_0: Because the teaching is well explained.”
ai-an1:326.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the one who lives lazy, and lives happily.
ai-an1:326.1.3_0: Because the teaching is poorly explained.”
ai-an1:327.1.1_0: “Mendicants, in a well explained teaching and training an energetic person lives happily.
ai-an1:327.1.3_0: Because the teaching is well explained.”
ai-an1:328.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if a little bag is smelly.
ai-an1:328.1.2_0: so too I don’t approve of even a tiny bit of continued existence, not even as long as a finger-snap.”
ai-an1:329.1.1_0: “Just as even a tiny bit of urine,
ai-an1:329.1.1_1: The distributor of spit is smelly.
ai-an1:329.1.2_0: so too I don’t approve of even a tiny bit of continued existence, not even as long as a finger-snap.”
ai-an1:329.1.3_0: The third sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-an1:333.1.1_0: “Just as, mendicants, in India the delightful parks, woods, meadows, and lotus ponds are few,
ai-an1:333.1.2_0: while the hilly terrain, inaccessible riverlands, stumps and thorns, and rugged mountains are many;
ai-an1:333.1.3_0: so too the sentient beings born on land are few, while those born in water are many.
ai-an1:334.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings reborn as humans are few,
ai-an1:334.1.2_0: while those not reborn as humans are many.
ai-an1:335.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings reborn in civilized countries are few,
ai-an1:335.1.2_0: while those reborn in the borderlands, among strange barbarian tribes, are many.
ai-an1:336.1.1_1: In the same way, the sentient beings who are wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.
ai-an1:336.1.2_0: while the sentient beings who are witless, dull, stupid, and unable to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said are many.
ai-an1:337.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who have the noble eye of wisdom are few,
ai-an1:337.1.2_0: while those who are ignorant and confused are many.
ai-an1:338.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who get to see a Realized One are few,
ai-an1:338.1.2_0: while those who don’t get to see a Realized One are many.
ai-an1:339.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who get to hear the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One are few,
ai-an1:339.1.2_0: while those who don’t get the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One are many.
ai-an1:340.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who remember the teachings they hear are few,
ai-an1:340.1.2_0: while those who don’t remember the teachings are many.
ai-an1:341.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who examine the meaning of the teachings they have memorized are few,
ai-an1:341.1.2_0: while those who don’t examine the meaning of the teachings are many.
ai-an1:342.1.1_1: In the same way, those who understand the meaning and the teaching and practice accordingly are few,
ai-an1:342.1.2_0: while those who understand the meaning and the teaching but don’t practice accordingly are many.
ai-an1:343.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings inspired by inspiring places are few,
ai-an1:343.1.2_0: while those who are uninspired are many.
ai-an1:344.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who, being inspired, strive effectively are few,
ai-an1:344.1.2_0: while those who, even though inspired, don’t strive effectively are many.
ai-an1:345.1.1_1: In the same way, the sentient beings gain immersion relying on letting go are few, gain unification of mind.
ai-an1:345.1.2_0: while those who don’t gain immersion, don’t gain unification of mind relying on letting go are many.
ai-an1:346.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who get the best food and flavors are few,
ai-an1:346.1.2_0: while those who don’t get the best food and flavors, but get by with scraps in an alms bowl are many.
ai-an1:347.1.1_0: ... so too the sentient beings who get the meaning of the teaching and the Saṅgha are few,
ai-an1:347.1.2_0: while those who don’t get the meaning, the teaching, and the Saṅgha are many.
ai-an1:347.1.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an1:347.1.4_0: ‘We will get the essence of the meaning, the essence of the teaching, the essence of freedom.’

ai-an1:600-615.1.1_11: leads to lighting up the light.
ai-an1:600-615.1.4_0: This one thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to gaining wisdom.
ai-an1:600-615.1.4_4: of many ways that leads to wide wisdom,
ai-an1:600-615.1.4_11: leads to lighting up the light.
ai-an1:616.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who enjoy mindfulness of the body haven’t enjoyed the deathless.
ai-an1:616.1.2_0: Those who enjoy mindfulness of the body enjoy the deathless.”
ai-an1:617.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who haven’t enjoyed mindfulness of the body haven’t enjoyed the deathless.
ai-an1:617.1.2_0: Those who have enjoyed mindfulness of the body have enjoyed the deathless.”
ai-an1:618.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who have lost mindfulness of the body have lost the deathless.
ai-an1:618.1.2_0: Those who have not completely understood mindfulness of the body haven’t faded away.”
ai-an1:619.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who have lost mindfulness of the body have enjoyed the deathless.
ai-an1:619.1.2_0: Those who have undertaken mindfulness of the body have undertaken the deathless.”
ai-an1:620.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who have neglected mindfulness of the body have neglected the deathless.
ai-an1:620.1.2_0: Those who have not neglected mindfulness of the body have not neglected the deathless.”
ai-an1:621.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who have forgotten mindfulness of the body have forgotten the deathless.
ai-an1:621.1.2_0: Those who haven’t forgotten mindfulness of the body haven’t forgotten the deathless.”
ai-an1:622.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who haven’t cultivated mindfulness of the body haven’t cultivated the deathless.
ai-an1:622.1.2_0: Those who have had earned mindfulness of the body have enjoyed the deathless.”
ai-an1:623.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who haven’t developed mindfulness of the body haven’t developed the deathless.
ai-an1:623.1.2_0: Those who have developed mindfulness of the body have developed the deathless.”
ai-an1:624.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who haven’t done mindfulness of the body haven’t cultivated the deathless.
ai-an1:624.1.2_0: Those who have developed and cultivated mindfulness of the body have been developed and cultivated.”
ai-an1:625.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who haven’t had insight into mindfulness of the body haven’t had insight into the deathless.
ai-an1:625.1.2_0: Those who have had insight into mindfulness of the body have had insight into the deathless.”
ai-an1:626.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who haven’t completely understood mindfulness of the body haven’t completely understood the deathless.
ai-an1:626.1.2_0: Those who have completely understood mindfulness of the body have completely understood the deathless.”
ai-an1:627.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who haven’t realized mindfulness of the body haven’t realized the deathless.
ai-an1:627.1.2_0: Those who have realized mindfulness of the body haven’t realized the deathless.”
ai-an1:627.2.1_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-an1:627.2.2_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-an1:627.2.4_0: The Book of the Ones is finished.
